titles.title: To redesignate Great Kills Park in the Gateway National Recreation Area as "World War II Veterans Park at Great Kills".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Subcommittee Hearings Held.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-188.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 106.

action.text: Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 231 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 592 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. makes in order the Committee on Resources amendment in the nature of a substitute as an original bill for purpose of amendment. Waives clause 7 of rule XVI (prohibiting nongermane amendments). Measure will be considered read. Bill is open to amendments.
Rule H. Res. 231 passed House.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 231.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 592 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Makes in order the Committee on Resources amendment in the nature of a substitute as an original bill for purpose of amendment. Waives clause 7 of rule XVI (prohibiting nongermane amendments). Measure will be considered read. Bill is open to amendments.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 231 and Rule XXIII.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Henry Bonilla to act as Chairman of the Committee.
GENERAL DEBATE - The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 592.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 592.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

vote.text: On passage Passed by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 106-212.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 368.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 6/30/1999--Passed House amended. Designates the Staten Island Unit of Miller Field in the Gateway National Recreation Area as World War Veterans Park at Miller Field.
